result.execSummary:
The defendant Hali Storm Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:29 PM.
Defendant Hali Storm Smith in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant will withdraw her plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enter a plea of "NO CONTEST" to the single count.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Bucher re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea is made freely, knowingly and intelligently.
Court accept plea and find the defendant "GUILTY"
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties ($100.00 base plus court costs - $579.00 total).
Attorney Bucher concurs with the state and moves for $100.00 base puls costs.
Court grants motion of the parties.

Defendant Hali Storm Smith appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Ellen Bucher in court for Defendant Hali Storm Smith.
Attorney Bucher informs the court that this matter is not resolved and moves for trial.

Case called at 2:41 PM.
Defendant Hali Storm Smith in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court an offer has been made and moves for more time for discovery.
No objection by the state.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:07 AM.
Defendant Hali Storm Smith in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant provided a copy of the criminal complaint, court reads charge portion onto the record.
State requests $1,000.00 signature bond No acts/threats Melissa Wurtzbacher.
Defendant stands "MUTE"
Court enters "NOT GUILTY" on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Melissa Wurtzbacher.
"Mary E. Richards" told deputy that Ms. Smith moved to Madison and does not have a phone.
